Title: First Contact
Default_Spirits: River Surges in Sunlight, Lightning's Swift Strike, Shadows Flicker Like Flame
Game_Effects: Use Blitz default scenario
Description:
Dahan have been part of the island's life for a long time. So long, in fact, that some spirits don't remember a time without them. As such, the arrival of new Dahan, in strangely shaped ships, is at most a mild surprise to spirits of the island. It is only when they start building, unexpectedly fast, that spirits realise there's something different about them. Those are not Dahan at all - they are something completely different, and much more damaging.

River Surges in Sunlight, first, realises the threat. Hurriedly, it contacts nearby spirits. Vital Strength of the Earth, calmly sleeping, barely responds. Luckily, two other spirits are faster to react: Shadows Flicker Like Flame, and Lightning's Swift Strike.
Victory_Text: The invaders' ships are still visible on the horizon. They may be keeping their distance right now, but there is little doubt in any one spirit's mind: they will be coming back. On a common accord, they decide to work together to rouse Vital Strength of the Earth and ask it to lend a hand.

Title: A New Spirit
Default_Spirits: Stone's Unyielding Defiance, Shattered Days Split the Sky, Vital Strength of the Earth
Game_Effects: Use A Diversity of Spirits default scenario
Description: New to the world and unaccustomed to its rules, the new spirit Seeking its Form sattaches itself to Stone's Unyielding Defiance, following it in its resistance against the invaders. Yet unable to speak to each other, spirits had to seek new ways of communicating with one another.
Victory_Text:
Stone's Unyielding Defiance now being supported by two spirits down from the heavens, Vital Strength of the Earth expresses a desire to go back to its own island, where it is desperately needed. Before it leaves, however, Stone's Unyielding Defiance offers this in thanks: to guide it to a location on the island where old artifacts are bound to make Vital Strength of the Earth significantly Mightier.
In the meantime, Shattered Days Split the Sky offers to seek the single piece of Sunshine that fell from the impact: it is bound to come in helpful, especially to a certain River spirit.

Title: Bring Beasts Forth
Default_Spirits: A Spread of Rampant Green, Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares
Game_Effects: Additional victory condition: have a beasts token and the presence of either spirit in every jungle.
Description: A spirit of fangs and claws, with a sharp scent. One who sees in the dark, and can hear a noise from miles away. Surely, such a spirit would know of the object Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares spoke of. Usually, it lurks within luxuriant jungles...
Victory_Text: A dark, sultry voice emerges from somewhere Behind the Leaves. Dahan are often blind to anything that is not directly in front of them, but beasts may scout the land and find much more than meets a human's eye. Certainly, beasts could seek those objects... Alas, there are spirits below the surface, within the flowing water and hiding within jungle leaves, and they do not always welcome such inquisition. Who knows how they may react?

Title: ASPECT of Wind
Mandatory_Spirits: Finder of Paths Unseen, Lightning's Swift Strike
Game_Effects:
Use Powers Long Forgotten default scenario.
Additional loss condition: invaders discover all sources of power.
Spirits do not benefit from the first source of power they find.
Description:
Some legends say the Pathmaker can open up portals, linking two places as though they were adjacent. Others believe the Pathmaker has no such ability; instead, it moves as swiftly as the Wind from one place to the next, carrying spirits and Dahan on its wings. Perhaps both are true?
We know that Lightning's Swift Strike and the Pathmaker had a long conversation, though we do not know what was said. Somehow, as the spirits were seeking the source of power that brought them together, everything around them seemed to become more frantic...
Victory_Text: As the search progressed, everything in the island seemed to accelerate: Dahan and invaders, beasts and wilds. The land itself evolved more rapidly, healing from its wounds faster than usual. Even after Lightning's Swift Strike's departure, the island seemed to stay on this unnaturally accelerated tempo.
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, unlock Lightning's Swift Strike's Wind aspect.
If you won during your second game, instead reveal Artifact #34.
Regardless of the outcome, unlock Scenario #41.

Title: The Plantation Colony
Default_Spirits: Grinning Trickster Stirs Up Trouble, Downpour Drenches the World, Many Minds Move as One
Game_Effects: Use Guard the Isle's Heart default scenario
Description: On a South-Western island of the archipelago, a new kind of invader is reaching the coasts: one interested in turning the island into a plantation colony. To do so, they have brought other invaders, against their will, and are having them work in their place. Such a situation is unstable at best, and when such a metaphorical powder keg is placed nearby, there is bound to be a spirit to provide a match...
Victory_Text: Seldom has Grinning Trickster Stirs Up Trouble seemed so invested in the island's defense. When it suggests to Downpour Drenches the World and Many Minds Move as One to help aspect-seeking spirits as it defends the island, the other two agree without hesitation: Downpour Drenches the World is delighted at the prospect of another rain-dance with Lightning's Swift Strike, and who knows what goes on in those Many Minds?

Title: Stalker of Hidden Secrets
Default_Spirits: A Spread of Rampant Green, Sharp Fangs Behind the Leaves, Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares
Game_Effects: Use Rituals of Terror default scenario.
Description: Such a spirit as the Stalker of Hidden Secret is not easily found... and finding it does not mean that it will be willing to share any information. Yet it is the best chance of finding an answer. Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares suggests an offering of sorts - an opportunity for an acute spirit to see glimpses of the invaders' innermost fears: a valuable currency for some spirits.
Victory_Text: Stalker of Hidden Secrets does not so easily reveal itself, but the Ritual does not go unrewarded: as the last Ritual is being performed, all spirits share a vision, in which invaders of all origins strike bargains with Hearth-Vigil. As part of this bargain, Hearth-Vigil whispers rumours of objects of immense power hidden within the bowels of the earth. The invaders' eyes widen with greed. What they seek is a magic that would make them invulnerable!

Title: BENEATH THE ARCHIPELAGO: Memorabilia
Game_Effects:
Use Powers Long Forgotten default scenario
WARNING: Loss will result in the end of this side story.
Description: There is no convincing Volcano Looming High to help any further; if anything, its anger threatens to put an early end to the spirits' quest. It did, however, point them in the right direction: if the Serpent's prison is made out of Stone, then perhaps a spirit of Stone would be willing to lend a hand. Perhaps somewhere under the earth, there is a key to freeing the long-imprisoned spirit.
Victory_Text: Nobody, not even Stone's Unyielding Defiance, could have expected what followed: from the bottom of the sea, an entire island emerged. On it, beasts and Dahan were already well-established, apparently unaware of the watery ceiling they lived under for all those years. The island appears to be pulsating from a majestic energy, sure sign of the might of the spirit Slumbering Beneath.
Unlocks: If you won (either during your first or second game), unlock Scenario #70

Title: An Ocean Away
Default_Spirits: River Surges in Sunlight, Ocean's Hungry Grasp, Thunderspeaker
Restricted_Spirits: Lightning's Swift Strike, Vital Strength of the Earth, Shadows Flicker like Flame
Game_Effects: (none)
Description: River Surges in Sunlight crossed the archipelago, seeking the help of a kindred spirit from the watery depths: Ocean's Hungry Grasp. Nowhere to be found on the high seas, and nowhere to be found in the deep caves where it occasionally lurks; River Surges in Sunlight ultimately finds it oddly closer to shores. However, this is quickly explained as ships appear on the horizon. In the sky, a thunderous roar echoes as Ocean's Hungry Grasp chortles in satisfaction: today, its hunger may yet be sated.
Victory_Text: Help, explains Ocean's Hungry Grasp, cannot be provided, as already it is providing assistance to Thunderspeaker. The ocean can be everywhere at once, but its hunger has limits, and no storm lasts forever. It is empty-handed that River Surges in Sunlight comes back to its original island.

Title: Field Experience
Game_Effects: Use Rituals of the Destroying Flame default scenario
Description: One is not only defined by one's will: events also come into play. As such, Starlight Seeks its Form was invited to partake in the defense directly, for words and demonstrations cannot compare with direct experience. It is a risky decision, as invaders are already protected by their own rituals and Hearth-Vigil's blessing, but it is bound to be a defining moment of the new spirit's existence.
Victory_Text: As the protection surrounding the invaders start to fade away once more, spirits are hailed by the Pathmaker, bearing news: spirits from all over the archipelago are gathering to discuss events relevant to them all. It is said that Many Minds Move as One bears news for those who can understand it; and that the very future of the archipelago may hang on the outcome of this meeting.

Title: A Second Barrier
Default_Spirits: Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds, Thunderspeaker, Ocean's Hungry Grasp
Game_Effects: Use rituals of terror default scenario.
Description:
Invaders are still fighting against the wall that has been erected before them, buying a bit of time for spirits to plan and discuss. It is agreed that their next step should be to seek out Hearth-Vigil, but none knows where it is.
As the spirits discourse, an increasingly high number of eyes spy upon them from the nearby jungle. A deep, sultry voice emerges from Behind the Leaves: if Hearth-Vigil helps the invaders, then surely it is among them that they should seek.
Spirits consider this advice: it is sensible, however none of them have much contact with the newcomers.
Oh, but there is one who can help, continues the voice Behind the Leaves. On an island South of here. Only, its help may not come cheap...
Spirits ponder upon this, and eventually agree to go and seek that spirit's help. Before leaving, they agree to perform another ritual, an additional layer of protection, for the wards they put on the shores will not last eternally.
Behind the Leaves, the spirit Grins.
Victory_Text:
Spirits prepare to depart, with the exception of Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds, duty-bound to the island.
As you travel, it says, consider crossing the Deepest Wilderness and reaching the Highest Volcano. There, you will find a child of Green and Fire. Should we need any additional help, consider waking it up. Be careful, however, as it is still young and carefree, and it may do more harm than good.

Title: Survival Instinct
Mandatory_Spirits: Vengeance as a Burning Plague, Shroud of Silent Mist
Game_Effects: Use Dahan Insurrection default scenario.
Description: Vengeance as a Burning Plague and Shroud of Silent Mist continue their work of destruction. Desperate for their survival, Dahan, believing their salvation cannot come as long as invaders are present, are growing increasingly agitated. In an attempt to calm the spirits of destruction, they decide to do their best to rid the island of invaders altogether.
Victory_Text: Invaders may have taken a blow, but already new ships appear on the horizon. Mist and Plague do not falter, and Dahan are growing desperate. Thankfully, help is on the horizon

Title: AFFINITY - Spirits of Kinship with Dahan
Mandatory_Spirits: Thunderspeaker, Grinning Trickster Stirs Up Trouble
Game_Effects: Use Despicable Theft default scenario
Description:
Quit following me! shouts Thunderspeaker.
Oh? it answers. But if I left, who would tell you about the Spirit-Speaker who made a deal with invaders, and is currently offering them various baubles forged by your very hands?
This has better not be another one of your trick, grumbles Thunderspeaker as it rushes toward the nearby Dahan encampment.
Victory_Text: Among Dahan, there is something of a saying: be careful when calling spirits for help. The Thunderspeaker may answer, if you are lucky. If you are not, it may answer still, but will have a few too many eyes.
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, reveal Artifact #23 and Artifact #39.
If you won during your second game, only reveal Artifact #23.

Title: Habsburg Showdown
Mandatory_Spirits: Stone's Unyielding Defiance, Fractured Days Split the Sky, Starlight Seeks its Form
Game_Effects:
If you have used Flag #9, unlock one among the mandatory spirits for this scenario. If you have already unlocked them all, increase your FINAL SCORE by 1.
If you have used Flag #10, unlock one among the mandatory spirits for this scenario. If you have already unlocked them all, increase your FINAL SCORE by 1.
Use Elemental Invocation default scenario
Description: Invaders had a bit of time to prepare, and have decided to try to stand fast against the spirits. By now, however, the elements themselves have been alerted by the spirits' intend, and are willing to lend a hand.
Victory_Text: As spirits celebrate their victory, their attention is drawn to the very centre of the island, where a battle of a different nature is taking place.

Title: Prussian CONFRONTATION
Default_Spirits: Vital Strength of the Earth, Lightning's Swift Strike, River Surges in Sunlight, Shadows Flicker Like Flame
Game_Effects: Use Guard the Isle's Heart default scenario
Description:
Spirits regroup. River Surges in Sunlight shares Ocean's Hungry Grasp's refusal, and Shadows Flicker Like Flame mentions the cryptic rumour among the Dahan, concerning a new strategy adopted by the invaders. Surprisingly, Lightning's Swift Strike remains quiet and contemplative, very much unlike its usual demeanour.
The spirits have little time to contemplate their next steps: already, a new wave of invaders is pouring it. This time, they seem especially curious, and especially drawn to the centre of the island. While the meaning of this behaviour eludes them, the spirits are certain of one thing: the invaders must not reach that which they seek.
Victory_Text:
The question floats in the air, remaining unanswered: what were the invaders seeking? As there is no point in asking a question when it is clear no answer can be provided, all spirits abstain. It is in this silence that Lightning's Swift Strike speaks, describing what it saw high up in the Shattered Sky: different aspects of themselves, taking the shape of old objects charged with ancestral power, hidden beneath the earth. (Rephrase) Hidden, and awaiting the day they would surface again. In those ancient objects may lie the answer to their predicament.

Spirits agree: some of them would have to stay on the island, defending it as best they can, while others may go on a search of those objects, hoping to alter the course of events in their favour.
Unlocks:
Reveal Flag #1, Flag #2 and Artifact #19.

Unlock Scenario #57.

Title: To Save A Dahan's Life
Restricted_Spirits: Vengeance as a Burning Plague, Shroud of Silent Mist
Game_Effects: Use Ward the Shores default scenario.
Description:
Volcano Looming High cares little for the content of the gathering: two spirits of destruction are loose on its island, and while it is usually the one being known for causing widespread destruction, this time the destruction is out of its control - and out of control in general.
Most spirits do not care much for Volcano Looming High's alarm: aren't invaders destroying islands all over the archipelago?
Thankfully, one of them agrees to help, for the sake of the Dahan that are dying every day. Thus an uneasy truce is formed between the Volcano that caused a great many Dahan's deaths and their champion.
Of course, before leaving, Thunderspeaker insists on raising protections to its own island, so Dahan and other spirits may defend it in its absence.
Victory_Text: Who knows what could remain of the island since Volcano Looming High left? Hurried and dreadful, the spirits hurry back.

Title: A Dwindling Flame
Default_Spirits: Lure of the Deep Wilderness, Shifting Memory of Ages, Finder of Paths Unseen
Game_Effects: Use Rituals of the Destroying Flame default scenario
Description: The barrier surrounding the island is not fully erected, and invaders are still circumventing it with ease. As spirits regroup, they notice that the Sun is burning bright in the sky: sure sign of a Ritual happening.
Victory_Text: Spirits manage to scare invaders away, but a few stay behind, hypnotized by Lure of the Deep Wilderness. Individual invaders escape notice more easily than large groups, and who knows how the ritual is going to affect the powerful appeal of the Deep Wilderness?

Title: To interact with a Web of Souls
Mandatory_Spirits: Many Minds Move as One, Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares
Game_Effects: Use A Diversity of Spirits default scenario
Description: Weaves a Web of Souls is not difficult to find: it is, after a fashion, ubiquitous, as long as there are beings that are part of the Web of Souls. Interacting with it, however, is not easy: it is necessary to be able to understand beings formed of multiple minds, and the complex individuality of each of those minds. Many Minds Move as One knows this, and sought one who could help it in this interaction... and when it comes to understanding invaders' innermost thoughts and dreams, it is not difficult to know who to call.
Victory_Text: Communication is not easy, and definitely not straightforward, but before long, Many Minds Move as One achieves something like an understanding of Weaves a Web of Souls' intentions. It also learns of the recent events in its own island, for the dreams of invaders are soon filled with promises of invulnerability. Many Minds Move as One departs in a hurry: whatever it has learned will have to wait.

Title: A Lone, Unyielding Spirit
Mandatory_Spirits: Stone's Unyielding Defiance, Vital Strength of the Earth
Game_Effects: Use Rituals of the Destroying Flame default scenario
Description: The invaders' newfound invulnerability scared most spirits away, fleeing and regrouping elsewhere. On a lone island on the Southmost point of the archipelago, only a handful of spirits and Dahan remained: Dahan unwilling to abandon the island on which they were born and raised, or yet unaware of the invaders' magic. Among the remaining spirits, most were small enough to go by unnoticed, or were already siding with the invaders; only one decided to stay and face the invaders heads-on, Unyielding to the last. It called for all the help it could get, hoping that its sibling, if nobody else, would hear it and come to support its resistance.
Victory_Text: Stone and Earth working in unison are remarkable adversaries, and by working together, they managed to fend off the first wave, though only at great cost. Yet as a new wave appeared on the horizon, neither suggested departing: they would stay and defend this island to the last...

Title: ASPECT of Pandemonium
Mandatory_Spirits: Lightning's Swift Strike, Downpour Drenches the World
Game_Effects: Use Elemental Invocation default scenario
Description: How long has it been, says Downpour Drenches the World, since we danced together in the heavens, let rain fall upon the world in joyous tumult, and revelled in the smell of mildew and wet grass? Come, cross the archipelago, join me, let us unleash the elements upon this island, and let us dance the night away!
Victory_Text: The spirits' dance unleashed chaos on an unprecedented scale. Down below, on the island, there is nothing but confusion and uproar. It looks as though entire parts of the island are joining in the dance, shifting and moving to accompany the spirits, and Dahan, invaders and beasts are brought along, thoroughly confused as the island revolves around them.
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, unlock Lightning's Swift Strike's Pandemonium aspect.
If you won during your second game, instead reveal Artifact #33
Regardless of the outcome, unlock Scenario #78

Title: Sometimes Heard From Again
Game_Effects: Use Despicable Theft default scenario
Description:
Protected by the Ritual of the Destroying Flame, some invaders not only made their way to the Deep Wilderness, but also managed to come back.
Spirits, as Dahan, can be prey to violent emotions, even spirits as odd as Lure of the Deep Wilderness. Upon seeing them depart, it flew into a rage, deploying every tool in its arsenal to ensure such happenstance would never, ever happen again.
Victory_Text: During this time, the Pathmaker was nowhere to be seen: last minute coordination efforts were to be made to arrange for the gathering of all spirits... and invaders are still coming to the island, Lured ever inward.

Title: Making Amends to the Land
Default_Spirits: Downpour Drenches the World, Many Minds Move as One
Game_Effects: Use Varied Terrains default scenario
Description:
Already, some smaller spirits have decided to provide help to the invaders in retaliation for the events they have been put through.
As Downpour Drenches the World and Many Minds Move as One approach smaller spirits to make amends, they realise there is one missing: Grinning Trickster Stirs Up Trouble is nowhere to be seen. Hopefully it went back to defend the rest of the island, which had already been left unattended for quite some time.
Victory_Text: Spirits large and small eventually come to an uneasy agreement. As soon as this is done, Many Minds Move as One departs: it has always been close to Weaves a Web of Souls; perhaps they could find each other, and come to an understanding?

Title: Too Short a Barrier
Default_Spirits: River Surges in Sunlight, Lightning's Swift Strike, Shadows Flicker Like Flame, Vital Strength of the Earth
Board_Setup: Coastline, formed with 3 boards instead of 2.
Game_Effects:
Do not place any invaders on the central board; place Dahan, blight, disease and beasts as usual. The shores of the central board are not considered coastal for the sake of exploring for this game. Place a Scenario token on all shores of the middle board; in each of those lands, Defend 3. Place spirits' original presence on the top and bottom board.
Build actions are skipped in the middle board for the entire game.
Thunderspeaker cannot be unlocked during this game.
Description: Shadows Flicker Like Flame's arrival almost goes unnoticed: already, invaders are pouring from both sides of the magical barrier that has been created on the shores. Reunions will have to wait; invaders will not.
Victory_Text: The spirits ultimately manage to repel the invaders, but it is clear to all that it is but a temporary respite. Upon learning of trouble on other islands, they take a quick decision: River Surges in Sunlight offers to seek the help of a long-time ally living further away from the shores; whereas Lightning's Swift Strike takes it upon itself to warn as many spirits as possible throughout the archipelago.

Title: Russian CONFRONTATION
Default_Spirits: Lure of the Deep Wilderness, Finder of Paths Unseen, Shifting Memory of Ages
Game_Effects:
Play your first game without any scenario.
If you win, play a second time with the Second Wave default scenario. This game is only considered won if you won both times. The adjustment to adversary level specified in the Second Wave default scenario is only temporary; as such, Adversary Level should go up by a total of 1, not 2, after both games have been played.

If you lose your first game, you have to win both games once again.

Spirits cannot be unlocked or mastered during this scenario.
Description: The Pathmaker comes back just in time: if spirits are to be welcomed here, the island needs to be emptied of troublemakers, thoroughly.
Victory_Text: Spirits do their best to chase away as many invaders as they could, but they all know this is only a temporary solution. In this case, temporary may be good enough: already, spirits from all over the archipelago are starting to arrive.
Unlocks:
Reveal Flag #11, Flag #12 and Artifact #51.
Unlock Scenario #54

Title: Unexpected Help
Default_Spirits: Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds, Ocean's Hungry Grasp, Thunderspeaker, Grinning Trickster Stirs Up Trouble
Game_Effects: Use Guard the Isle's heart default scenario.
Description: Spirits arrive in the nick of time: invaders managed to clear up the wilds that protected the shores, and their ritual of terror seems to barely restrain the invaders, eyes bright with greed. Inch by inch, they make their way toward the heart of the island. It is fortunate that the spirits came back when they did. As they start bolstering the island's defense, they notice unexpected events: beasts at unexpected locations; conflict and strife among Dahan and invaders both...
Victory_Text:
Spirits mention disappointment and anger after their fruitless trip.
As they do so, a bird with many eyes lands close to them, greeting them with a Grin. Stalker of Hidden Secrets did not lie, it says, but it did not tell the full truth either. Hearth-Vigil is not alone in helping the invaders, there is at least another one with it. One who Weaves a Web of Souls.
This explains much: the fear of a small group of invaders is offset by the greed of all those left behind, now shared through a Web of Souls. Spirits' understanding of the situation takes a new form: it will not be enough to scare off small groups of invaders: a coordinated effort throughout the archipelago will be required to push the invaders back.
And what of Hearth-Vigil's location?, they ask.
The many-eyed bird is gone.

Title: AFFINITY - Spirits of Resilient Flora
Mandatory_Spirits: A Spread of Rampant Green, Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds
Game_Effects: Use The Great River default scenario
Description: Rumour is, on the land from which invaders came, there is always demand for new cash crops. As such, invaders could be tempted to try to go ever more inland, seeking new terrains to cultivate, ever expanding their plantation colony. In this case, they are bound to hit a wall. Specifically, a wall of thorns and branches, and ever Spreading Green.
Victory_Text:
Rumour is, after their encounter with A Spread of Rampant Green and Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds, some invaders abandoned the plantation colony altogether, terrified at the prospect that the crops they are cultivating may one day uproot themselves and turn against them.
They may be right.
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, reveal Artifact #8 and Artifact #50.
If you won during your second game, only reveal Artifact #50.

Title: Prussia's Efficiency
Default_Spirits: Lightning's Swift Strike, River Surges in Sunlight, Shadows Flicker Like Flame
Game_Effects: On each starting land with 2 Dahan, place only 1 Dahan. On each starting land with 1 Dahan, don't place Dahan at all. At the beginning of each spirit phase, add 1 Dahan (total, not per board) on any land with Dahan.
Description: Those newcomers are unlike anything the spirits have ever seen! In the short amount of time they were gone to rouse Vital Strength of the Earth, the invaders have extended their reach from one shore to the other! Worse still, it seems they scared the Dahan away: a lot of them are hiding or on the run. There is no time to ponder upon this now: first, the invaders must be repelled. Perhaps the joint efforts of the remaining Dahan and the spirits may convince a few more Dahan to come back?
Victory_Text: As the dust settles on the once again quiet island, Shadows Flicker Like Flame mentions tales and heresays among Dahan. The spirits originally thought the Dahan were running away, but they were mistaken: Dahan were rather answering a call by another spirit, on another island, one going by the name of Thunderspeaker. Little else is known. Without saying another word, Shadows Flicker Like Flame disappears, leaving the other spirits to fend for themselves.

Title: ASPECT of Resilience
Default_Spirits: Sharp Fangs Behind the Leaves, A Spread of Rampant Green, Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares
Game_Effects:
Use Powers Long Forgotten default scenario.
Additional loss condition: invaders discover all sources of power.
Spirits do not benefit from the first source of power they find.
Description: As soon as Vital Strength of the Earth takes shape on the island, everything seems to calm down. Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares itself chose a tamer, less terrifying aspect to greet their guests. Surely, the aspect they were looking for is nearby - all they have to do is to get their hands on it before the invaders do.
Victory_Text: Vital Strength of the Earth uses the opportunity of his visit to describe the invaders' odd behaviour on his island: clearly, they are seeking something. Something located deep within the islands. Indeed, as he describes the situation, a new wave of invaders arrive, visibly with the same intentions. A Spread of Rampant Green departs to warn a friendly spirit on a neighbouring island, leaving the others behind to defend the heart of the island.
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, unlock Vital Strength of the Earth's Resilience aspect.
If you won during your second game, instead reveal Artifact #13.
Regardless of the outcome, unlock Scenario #45 and #60.

Title: Scottish Showdown
Mandatory_Spirits: Vengeance as a Burning Plague, Volcano Looming High, Shroud of Silent Mist
Game_Effects:
If you have used Flag #13, unlock one spirit among the mandatory spirits for this scenario. If you have already unlocked them all, increase your FINAL SCORE by 1.
If you have used Flag #14, unlock one spirit among the mandatory spirits for this scenario. If you have already unlocked them all, increase your FINAL SCORE by 1.
Additional victory condition: terror level 3, there are neither cities nor town on the island.
Description: Invaders are trying as best they can to entrench themselves. They had a bit of time to prepare, but nothing can really prepare anyone to the combined anger of such spirits.
Victory_Text: Invaders from all over the island are trying to make a run for it. Spirits are divided: some of them want to exterminate them to the last; others believe it is best to terrify them to send a strong message. Fortunately, the island is large enough to accommodate both camps.

Title: Thunder and Lightning
Mandatory_Spirits: Lightning's Swift Strike, A Spread of Rampant Green
Game_Effects: Use blitz default scenario
Description: Lightning's Swift Strike soars high in the sky, and up there, it finds Thunderspeaker's roar, still echoing. It takes it and carries it on its wings, far and wide, so that every corner of the archipelago may hear it. The roar resonates like a warning, announcing the trouble to come, and urging spirits and Dahan to prepare. As Lightning's Swift Strike flies over the Northmost island of the archipelago, it is flagged down by A Spread of Rampant Green: here, the warning comes too late: invaders have already set foot on the island, and seem hell bent on making it their new home. Surely, a spirit as quick as lightning can find the time to lend a hand?
Victory_Text: Lightning's Swift Strike helps as best it can, and is gone before the dust settles. As it flies one last time above the archipelago to ensure it hasn't missed anything, its attention is drawn to the heavens - there, somewhere between Sun and Moon, halfway between Day and Night, it catches a glimpse of Might-Have-Been, or perhaps of Will-Be... troubled by what it saw, it bolts back to the island where Vital Strength of the Earth and Shadows Flicker Like Flame are holding the fort.

Title: Lost in the Swirling Haze
Mandatory_Spirits: Grinning Trickster Stirs Up Trouble, Shroud of Silent Mist
Game_Effects: Use The Great River default scenario
Description:
The plantation colony's restless state is fascinating to Grinning Trickster Stirs Up Trouble, and captures all its attention. Perhaps this explains its surprise when the mist generated by Downpour Drenches the World's incessant rain takes shape, its voice the echoes of the archipelago's pain. Did Grinning Trickster Stirs Up Trouble assist the birth of a new spirit? If so, what brought it into existence?
As the spirit's mind is riddled with questions, the invaders relentlessly attempt to reach the heart of the island, hell-bent on finding the secret of invulnerability.
Victory_Text: Grinning Trickster Stirs Up Trouble pokes and probes the new spirit, seeking answers, but the spirit provides none. Quickly, the Trickster grows bored with its investigation, and what is that sound in the distance? It looks like Downpour Drenches the World and Lightning's Swift Strike are having a wonderful time...

Title: Immense ASPECT
Game_Effects:
Use Powers Long Forgotten default scenario.
Additional loss condition: invaders discover all sources of power.
Spirits do not benefit from the first source of power they find.
Description:
As the story goes, it is on this island that Thunder was born from Lightning. On the sands where Lightning struck the ground, rumour has it there is now a crystalline formation in which Thunder still Roars Brightly. Could it still be there, after all this time? An echo of a time where the storm was Immense above the island?
Perhaps it was never so, and it is Thunderspeaker's tale, told and retold among the Dahan, that gave it reality?
The reason for Lightning's Swift Strike's growth may be nebulous, but as the sky darkens and the rain starts to fall, there is little doubt: whether reality gave birth to the story, or the other way around, something Immense is looming up above.
Victory_Text: Thunderspeaker keeps staring at the sky long after the storm has passed. Does it remember a time where it was called Bright Thunder Roars? Does it remember soaring across the sky on Lightning's Swift Strike's wings, crossing paths with Downpour Drenches the World in joyful celebration? Perhaps Thunderspeaker's gaze is instead focused on the future, where many questions are yet to be answered...
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, unlock Lightning's Swift Strike's Immense aspect.
If you won during your second game, instead reveal Artifact #60.
Regardless of the outcome, unlock Scenario #10.

Title: Spirit of Retribution
Mandatory_Spirits: Vengeance as a Burning Plague, Volcano Looming High
Game_Effects:
Volcano Looming High starts with the Volcanic Eruption major power.
At game setup but before the initial explore action, earn 6 fear. Then:
In Volcano Looming High's starting land:
-Destroy all Dahan, beasts and invaders.
-Add a blight from the box, without cascading or removing spirit presence.
-Add a Wilds token.

In all adjacent lands:
-Destroy all beasts and Dahan.
-If there are no blights, then add a blight from the box without cascading or removing spirit presence.

Stone's Unyielding Defiance cannot be unlocked during this scenario.
Description:
As it screams its increasing anger to the sky, Volcano Looming High is surprised to hear a different sound, one that does not come from it at all. As it spits its anger all over the land, it senses a presence leaving it to take a new form, now unleashed upon the land.
The entire land braces and rises in anger as the spirit of Vengeance leaves the simmering volcanic pool where it laid dormant for so long.
One should not call upon Vengeance as a Burning Plague lightly. Most would say one should not call upon it at all. Yet it is too late now, and there is no taking it back.
Victory_Text: The mist, temporarily chased away by the volcanic eruption, reforms once everything becomes quiet again. Volcano Looming High looks at the island with consternation: what has it done?

Title: CHILD OF THE VOLCANO AND THE GREEN: Destructive Nature
Game_Effects:
Use Elemental Invocation default scenario. Do not use a blight card; instead, use 10 blight tokens (as printed on the default board). For the purpose of events, the land is considered blighted from the start.

WARNING: Loss will result in the end of this side story.
Description:
Happily awakened, Heart of the Wildfire now roams free. It is joyful and impulsive, and little inclined to listen to spirits and their problems - the island is rich and full of promises, and much more enticing. The elements themselves seem to greet the newly awakened spirit to the surface of the island.
Awakening Heart of the Wildfire was one thing; convincing it to listen is another.
Victory_Text:
As Heart of the Wildfire slows down long enough to listen to their plight, spirits can't help but wonder: were they right to awaken it? Its efficiency against the invaders requires no more proof, but the land seems to suffer from its presence...
And just as spirits form those thoughts, they notice small sprouts emerging from the ground where the Wildfire had passed. It is said that The Burned Land Regrows...
Unlocks: If you won (either during your first game or second game), unlock Heart of the Wildfire.

Title: AFFINITY - Spirits of Darkness and Dread
Mandatory_Spirits: Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares, Shadows Flicker Like Flame
Game_Effects: Use Rituals of Terror default scenario
Description: Most spirits use fear to scare away invaders; some go out of their way to do so. Some go so far out of their way to do so, that they lure invaders for the sole purpose of testing the effect of new Rituals of Terror on them.
Victory_Text: Do Dahan collaborate with spirits because they remember the Years of the Relentless Sun? Do they do so because they remember a time before the invaders, when Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares was sought after and celebrated? As the island is flooded with nightmares, Dahan carry gratitude and hope.
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, reveal Artifact #10 and Artifact #18.
If you won during your second game, only reveal Artifact #18.

Title: Mist and Smoke
Default_Spirits: Volcano Looming High, Shroud of Silent Mist
Game_Effects:
Invader cards are face-down outside of the invader phase. This does not affect gameplay, it simply makes it harder for players to remember where invaders will act next.

When beasts / invaders / Dahan is gathered, instead of moving it to the target land, move it up by two lands (so an invader in land #5 would end up in land #7 of the same board). If it is in land #7, move it to land #8. Gather has no effect on beasts / invaders / Dahan in land #8.

When beasts / invaders / Dahan are pushed, instead of choosing the land to push it, instead move it down by two lands (so an invader in land #5 would end up in land #3 of the same board). If it is in land #2, move it to land #1. Push has no effect on beasts / invaders / Dahan in land #1.
Description:
It takes a long while for Volcano Looming High to understand, but eventually it realises that the mist responds to its smoke. It is a primitive means of communication, but enough for spirits to understand each other.
It does have a major drawback, for the entire island becomes clouded and none can see much. Who's to tell where Dahan and invaders are?
Victory_Text:
Confused by the lack of visibility and angered by the damage it senses to its precious mountains, now being mined for ore that does not exist in the first place, Volcano Looming High senses its anger burning hot. It has always been a short temper, but never has it felt a need of retribution on this scale before.
It can sense its belly burn, ready to erupt in a cataclysm that would ravage the entire island. At least, it would wipe the invaders clean.

Title: ASPECT of Reach
Mandatory_Spirits: Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds, Shadows Flicker Like Flame
Game_Effects:
Use Powers Long Forgotten default scenario.
Additional loss condition: invaders discover all sources of power.
Spirits do not benefit from the first source of power they find.
Description: There are many secrets hidden deep within the Wilds. Most are better left untouched; however the situation calls for the unveiling of one of them: a secret part of the island, secluded from the rest of the island, where the Shadows always seem unnaturally long. Dahan living there are often silent, as if entire villages were composed of mute villagers. It is a bizarre place, forgotten by most...
Victory_Text: Shadows Flicker Like Flame took shape without warning, searched the area restlessly and frantically, and disappeared without a word. Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds leaves in turn: it knows better than to expect thanks from such an alien spirit. Hopefully, some good will come out of this endeavour.
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, unlock Shadows Flicker Like Flame's Reach aspect.
If you won during your second game, instead reveal Artifact #53.
Regardless of the outcome, unlock Scenario #10.

Title: Preparing for Guests
Default_Spirits: Lure of the Deep Wilderness, Shifting Memory of Ages
Game_Effects: Use Ward the Shores default scenario
Description: News is slow to reach the centre of the island, but on the Pathmaker's wings, they do eventually reach even the farthest corners of the island: spirits are to gather at a nearby location. There, they are to discuss the presence of invaders, and exchange stories and strategies. It is an event of an unprecedented scope, and an opportunity to meet spirits from far and wide. With the Pathmaker busy informing spirits from all over the island, it is up to Lure of the Deep Wilderness and Shifting Memory of Ages to ensure the invaders will cause as little trouble as possible. Setting up a barrier on the shore is bound to be a good first step.
Victory_Text:
The Pathmaker comes back with news from the North-West: spirits there are seeking aspects of themselves solidified in sources of power. It would be a good opportunity to help them find what they seek.
Shifting Memory of Ages pensively steps back from those conversations: it thinks it may recall a way to help them all... only, it can't seem to fully remember what it was all about.

Title: AFFINITY - Spirits of beasts big and small
Mandatory_Spirits: Sharp Fangs Behind the Leaves, Many Minds Move as One
Game_Effects: Use Despicable Theft default scenario
Description: When invaders decide to hunt down game on the island, it is only a matter of time before the beasts decide to hunt back. When invaders decide to run away with whichever treasure they managed to find, hunters become the hunted.
Victory_Text: As invaders run away, they are bound to bring tales with them. Hopefully the tales of swarming and lurking beasts will outweigh any tales of treasures left on the island.
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, reveal Artifact #29 and Artifact #42.
If you won during your second game, only reveal Artifact #42.

Title: A Lesson from the Elements
Default_Spirits: Starlight Seeks its Form, Fractured Days Split the Sky, Stone's Unyielding Defiance
Game_Effects: Use Elemental Invocation default scenario.
Description: Starlight Seeks its Form is being offered a second opportunity to define itself: to greet the Elements themselves. As expected, invaders decide to meddle with the meeting, but perhaps this, too, could be turned into a teachable moment?
Victory_Text: Their meeting with the Elements completed, spirits move on to their last lesson, one they themselves had to learn during either the First or Second Reckoning.
Unlocks:
If you won (either during your first or second game), reveal Artifact #47.
Regardless of the outcome, unlock Scenario #82.

Title: French showdown
Mandatory_Spirits: Grinning Trickster Stirs Up Trouble, Downpour Drenches the World, Many Minds Move as One
Game_Effects:
If you have used Flag #7, unlock one spirit among the mandatory spirits for this scenario. If you have already unlocked them all, increase your FINAL SCORE by 1.
If you have used Flag #8, unlock one spirit among the mandatory spirits for this scenario. If you have already unlocked them all, increase your FINAL SCORE by 1.

Use Despicable Theft default scenario
Description: As the spirits arrive, invaders are already in the process of packing up and leaving. It appears they hope to bring home with them some of the objects they managed to steal during their expeditions on the island.
Victory_Text: As spirits watch French ships depart, it appears the night sky itself reaches down to touch the Southmost part of the island.

Title: Overclocked
Default_Spirits: Finder of Paths Unseen, Fractured Days Split the Sky
Restricted_Spirits: Lightning's Swift Strike, Shadows Flicker Like Flame, Shifting Memory of Ages, Lure of the Deep Wilderness
Game_Effects: Use Blitz default scenario
Description: As the legend goes, the collaboration of Lightning's Swift Strike and the Pathmaker resulted in such a frantic hurry that time itself got spun around, and forgot its usual pace to try to match theirs. Dahan appealed to spirits, asking them to let time return to its original pace. The Pathmaker, feeling responsible for the event, answered. A spirit made out of time itself did, too.
Victory_Text: Spirits fixed their mistakes and time went back to its original flow. It was time to go back to the core of the island: there was still much to do before the great reunion of spirits could begin.

Title: AFFINITY - Spirits of Wisdom Rooted in Stone
Mandatory_Spirits: Vital Strength of the Earth, Shifting Memory of Ages
Game_Effects: Use Guard the Isle's Heart default scenario.
Description: Such spirits as Vital Strength of the Earth and Shifting Memory of Ages are not easily brought into direct action. However, when invaders known for pillaging the land get too close to the heart of the island, they do not hesitate to spring into action.
Victory_Text: As the proverb goes, it is difficult to get a boulder rolling; however it is significantly more difficult to stop a rolling boulder. Perhaps invaders will learn something from this encounter.
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, reveal Artifact #6 and Artifact #58.
If you won during your second game, only reveal Artifact #6.

Title: Madness Spreads Far and Wide
Default_Spirits: A Spread of Rampant Green, Sharp Fang Behind the Leaves
Restricted_Spirits: Shadows Flicker Like Flame, Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares
Game_Effects: Play with Dahan Insurrection default scenario. In addition, whenever an action moves a Beasts token, it inflicts 1 damage to both invaders and Dahan in the land in which it finishes its movement.
Description:
Dahan and beasts alike roam mad. Someone is bound to get hurt, and there is no preventing it... but perhaps there is a way to use the situation to the spirits' advantage? Sadly, the invaders are taking heed of the situation, and have already called for reinforcements.
Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares, delighted by the situation, chooses to let events unfold without interfering.
Victory_Text:
As time passes, it becomes increasingly clear that time alone will not make the Madness go away. It does, however, scare away most of the invaders, buying a bit of time for the spirits. In this lull, Sharp Fangs Behind the Leaves' voice is once again heard: there are more artifacts to be uncovered. A Spread of Rampant Green hesitates: they cannot afford Pandemonium with this situation on their hands.
Quite the contrary, reassures Sharp Fangs Behind the Leaves' voice. This one is bound to bolster everyone's Resilience.

Title: ASPECT of Sunshine
Default_Spirits: Starlight Seeks its Form, Shattered Days Split the Sky
Game_Effects:
Use Powers Long Forgotten default scenario.
Additional loss condition: invaders discover all sources of power.
Spirits do not benefit from the first source of power they find.
Description: Sun's lost ray of Sunshine fell on the island, however the impact was such that it got buried under the earth, its light hidden from view. This did not stop everyone in the area from looking for it, from spirits to invaders. It is only a matter of time before someone finds it...
Victory_Text: Finding rays of Sunshine is extremely rare, and such happenstance needs spirits' undivided attention. However, invaders have the luxury of large groups; that is, they can both look for rare artifacts and try to take over islands at the same time. Their search completed, spirits hurry back to meet with Stone's Unyielding Defiance: the defense of the island cannot wait any longer.
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, unlock River Surges in Sunlight's Sunshine aspect.
If you won during your second game, instead reveal Artifact #21.
Regardless of the outcome, unlock Scenario #77.

Title: Rumours Rattle the Leaves
Mandatory_Spirits: A Spread of Rampant Green, Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds
Game_Effects:
Oceans count as coastal wetlands for all purposes for this game. The gap between boards counts as a single land representing the ocean, so going from one board to the next takes a range of 2: First board's ocean (now wetlands) -> space between boards (now ocean) -> other board's ocean (now wetlands).

Additional victory condition: both spirits must have a sacred site on the same land, on the board where Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds started.
Description: A Spread of Rampant Green chooses a point where the river separating its island from its South-Eastern neighbour is as thin as possible. There, it may be able to cross without too much hassle. Sadly, the invaders have already started exploring the area, and the low bedrock of the river offers them additional opportunities to build.
Victory_Text: The warnings A Spread of Rampant Green brings forth among its leaves mingle within the Wilds protected by the Keeper, and an understanding emerges: a Child is to be woken. With its slow, monumental presence, Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds leaves the jungles where it usually dwells, heading toward the coast, where the Thunder still roars.

Title: A Secret Plan
Game_Effects:
Use Ward the Shores default scenario.

From this scenario onward, you will calculate your score differently. This score will be referred to as your FINAL SCORE.
For each scenario you win during your first game, score 2 points.
For each scenario you win during your second game, score 1 point.
For each scenario you lose, score 0 points.
AFFINITY scenarios, CHILD OF THE VOLCANO AND THE GREEN scenarios and BENEATH THE ARCHIPELAGO scenarios do not improve your FINAL SCORE, but may still be played to unlock new artifacts or new spirits, or as opportunities to Master spirits.
Unlocking new spirits or Mastering spirits is still possible, but it does not increase your FINAL SCORE.
Description:
During the gathering, Many Minds Move as One revealed what it learned from its exchange with Weaves a Web of Souls: that the latter is the reason for their unquenchable greed and nerves of steel, and part of the reason they kept on coming back: by weaving together the souls of so many invaders, those on the island get to share all the enthusiasm, all the greed of those left behind. This, explains Many Minds Move as One with many beaks and many muzzles, has been their strength so far, and will also be their downfall.
Stalker of Hidden Secrets saw a fragment of Will-Be when Moon and Sun collided, and that knowledge echoed in time, in such a way that it was aware of the arrival of the invaders long before the first sail emerged on the horizon. Armed with such knowledge, it approached Hearth-Vigil and Weaves a Web of Souls with a plan:
For the invaders to leave and never come back, it would not be sufficient for a small group of invaders to be pushed away; their tales of horror would only amuse courageous explorers back where they came from, and inevitably, more would follow, again and again, until spirits ultimately fail to protect the island. However, if there was a way for those invaders, comfortably safe back home, to feel the fear and despair of those who came to the island, then hopefully, they would stop coming.
Hearth-Vigil gave the invaders the drive and courage to go to the island in droves, while Weaves a Web of Souls gathered as many invaders as it could in its Web. Now that the Web is large enough, all it would take to send the fear reverberating all the way to the invaders' home country would be a massive blow, affecting all invaders at once: a feeling that they are not welcome anywhere past their borders, for as long as they plan on colonizing new lands.
Stalker of Hidden Secrets reveals the location of an island near the archipelago, one unknown to spirits and sparsely inhabited by Dahan, that invaders used as a stepping stone to the rest of the archipelago. This is where spirits must now go, in a coordinated movement, to defend their island.
One last thing to do before leaving: ensuring invaders to not settle in while they are away.
Victory_Text: A temporary barrier in place, spirits prepare to depart to this new island. Organised in small groups, they are each tasked to bring the fight to the adversary they know best, to rid the archipelago of invaders once and for all.

Title: CHILD OF THE VOLCANO AND THE GREEN: A Path out of the Wilderness
Restricted_Spirits: Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds, Lure of the Deep Wilderness, Ocean's Hungry Grasp, Volcano Looming High
Game_Effects:
At the end of every turn, in each coastal land, move all invaders, beasts, Dahan and spirit presence to an inland land (unless the land is isolated).
If the origin land contained invaders, add one explorer to that land (after having moved all other invaders).

Additional victory condition: there is a presence from either spirit in all coastal lands at the time of victory.

WARNING: Loss will result in the end of this side story.
Description: Leaving the Deep Wilderness is not an easy task, not even for spirits. Fortunately, there is one who knows Paths Unseen - even paths out of the Deepest Wilderness. Its assistance may make it possible to leave; this does not mean it will make it easy. The presence of invaders only makes things worse.
Victory_Text: Spirits eventually leave the island, disoriented and confused, to find themselves before what could easily be the tallest mountain in the entire archipelago. As they approach, the ground rumbles: if A Spread of Rampant Green was one parent, it appears they have found the other.
Unlocks: If you won (either during your first or second game), unlock scenario #100.

Title: English Showdown
Mandatory_Spirits: A Spread of Rampant Green, Sharp Fangs Behind the Leaves, Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares
Game_Effects:
If you have used Flag #3, unlock one spirit among the mandatory spirits for this scenario. If you have already unlocked them all, increase your FINAL SCORE by 1.
If you have used Flag #4, unlock one spirit among the mandatory spirits for this scenario. If you have already unlocked them all, increase your FINAL SCORE by 1.

Use Guard the Isle's Heart default scenario.
Description: England's reaction is much like Prussia's: they immediately seek shelter deep within the island, where they presumably still hope to establish their capital.
Victory_Text: As the spirits complete their task of pushing back English invaders, the Thunder roars in the distance: the North-Eastern battle has already begun.

Title: ASPECT of Travel
Mandatory_Spirits: River Surges in Sunlight, Ocean's Hungry Grasp
Game_Effects:
Use Elemental Invocation default scenario.
The ocean from one board is adjacent to the ocean from the other board (therefore coasts are at range 3 from one another). 
Additional victory condition: River Surges in Sunlight must have presence on land #8 of both boards.
Description: Other spirits believe aspects of your new selves can be found under the earth, roars Ocean's Hungry Grasp. I am certain there are other ways. Travel across the Ocean, and let the Elements show you the way.
Victory_Text: Ocean's Hungry Grasp sighs with relief. Isn't this better than spending all one's time on the land? Now, the entire archipelago feels like it is within their Grasp.
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, unlock River Surges in Sunlight's Travel aspect.
If you won during your second game, instead reveal Artifact #4.
Regardless of the outcome, unlock Scenario #10.

Title: A Memory of the Past
Restricted_Spirits: Lightning's Swift Strike, Shadows Flicker Like Flame, Lure of the Deep Wilderness
Game_Effects:
Use Rituals of Terror default scenario, with the following changes:
Spirits may perform the Ritual of Memories if:
-There is a land with a sacred site from each spirit
-The spirits collectively spend 4/6/10 energy
-Shifting Memory of Ages destroys 8/12/20 Element Markers
-Dahan presence is not required.
Upon performing the ritual of terror, Dahan are not pushed.
Description: There is something that must be remembered; Shifting Memory of Ages knows this, but is unable to say more. Few spirits have been around long enough to help it; however it is said that the Pathmaker is one of the oldest of them all, despite its diminutive size. Shifting Memory of Ages asks for its help, to remember what was happening such a long time ago that almost the entire archipelago has forgotten about it, if they even knew in the first place.
Victory_Text:
Shifting Memory of Ages, feeling no different, expresses surprise.
Memories were far away, but they are on their way, explains the Pathmaker. Reuniting with such a memory is bound to take time. Thankfully, time itself appears to be in something of a hurry at the moment.

Title: Better Late than Never
Game_Effects:
Use Blitz default scenario.
On the first turn, Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds skips its growth phase. Gaining energy and playing cards is still done as usual.
On the second turn, it may play its growth phase twice.
Description: By the time Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds leaves its isolation, the invaders are already well-encroached in the area, forcing the spirit to be uncharacteristically fast if the shores are to be protected.
Victory_Text:
As the invaders leave the shores, the spirits exchange among each other: by now, they know a few things. Invaders are approaching every shore in the archipelago. They are seeking something hidden deep within the archipelago, motivated by Hearth-Vigil's promise that what they are looking for may grant them invulnerability... and some spirits are seeking fragments of themselves scattered throughout the island, helping them reach new heights and take on new forms. It is of the latter that they discuss most, for each of them believe they may know of such fragments.
Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds mentions a secret whispered behind walls of ever-growing trees, which may help them Reach out to Hearth-Vigil.
Ocean's Hungry Grasp, uneasy with its prolonged presence on the shore, is eager to Travel, and believes it knows of a way to enable them to do so.
Thunderspeaker remembers a time when it was younger, and its parent was Immense in its eye. Surely some memorabilia has been left behind, loaded with the heaviness of years and memories shared?
However, if they were to leave, the shore would be left unprotected. Ocean's Hungry Grasp mentions River Surges in Sunlight's ritual, and its mitigated success. Keeper of the Wilds then offers to bolster the ritual with a touch of its own...

Title: Extinguish the Destroying Flame
Default_Spirits: Volcano Looming High, Shroud of Silent Mist, Vengeance as a Burning Plague
Game_Effects: Use Rituals of the Destroying Flame default scenario
Description: It doesn't take much convincing for Vengeance as a Burning Plague and Shroud of Silent Mist to make their way to the South-East of the Archipelago, where invaders are still using the object of power they stole from the Sun - and when they are put under attack, they do not hesitate to put this power to use.
Victory_Text: Confronted by the anger of the spirits of destruction, more than willing to sacrifice everything, including themselves, to get rid of them, invaders stood little chance. Desperate, they attempt to flee to safer grounds, where they believe the spirits will be unable to follow.

Title: AFFINITY - Spirits of Intangible Perils
Mandatory_Spirits: Lure of the Deep Wilderness, Shroud of Silent Mist
Game_Effects:
Use Ward the Shores default scenario
When setting up the game, put Reaching Grasp on top of the minor powers deck.
Description:
Those spirits do not communicate; they simply exist, and in doing so, they represent a threat to all invaders. They were foolhardy to set foot on the island, and temerarious to venture deep into the land.
Perhaps now, the only thing worse than to be chased out of the island would be to be locked in, unable to leave.
Victory_Text: Nothing is known of what happened to the invaders that were locked in the island by Lure of the Deep Wilderness and Shroud of Silent Mist. They were Never Heard From Again. Since then, it is believed that the island is cursed, and Dahan and invaders both avoid it as best they can.
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, reveal Artifact #9 and Artifact #25.
If you won during your second game, only reveal Artifact #25.

Title: Those Left Behind
Default_Spirits: Volcano Looming High, Shroud of Silent Mist
Game_Effects: Use A Diversity of Spirits default scenario
Description:
All spirits were invited to this great gathering; and as such, very few decided to stay behind. This was the case of Volcano Looming High. Some believe it was slighted by the lack of tall mountains at the place of the meeting; other people believe it refused to depart from its usual stomping grounds. Other people believe it was angered by actions related to one of its old rivals.
However, nobody dared to ask it directly.

Left behind alone on its island, Volcano Looming High prepares to face a new wave of invaders, only to realise that the fog forming at its base is unnatural - and there seems to be something, or someone, walking in the thickest of the mist. It tries to reach out to this strange apparition, but is met with silence.
Victory_Text: Under the permanent fog, Volcano Looming High is having a hard time seeing what is happening. The only thing it knows is that the land it looked over for millennia is being ransacked, and deep within it, anger starts to grow.

Title: BENEATH THE ARCHIPELAGO: Feeding the Serpent
Game_Effects:
Terror levels are not earned via fear, but by the Ritual of Essence Consumption.
Do not resolve earned Fear Cards during the Invader Phase.
During either the fast or slow phase, Spirits may perform the Ritual of Essence Consumption if:
-There is at least one land with one presence from each spirit
-Serpent Slumbering Beneath the Island has 3 presence on its Deep Slumber track.
-spirits collectively spend 3 energy total

Upon performing the ritual:
-Earn the next Terror Level (this may be VICTORY on your third ritual)
-resolve all earned fear cards (at the new terror level)
-destroy 3 presence from Serpent Slumbering Beneath the Island's Deep Slumber track. The essence is considered destroyed, not removed from the game, and can be re-added to the board just like any other destroyed presence.
-If Serpent Slumbering Beneath the Island has more presence on the board than is now allowed, destroy the excessive presence.
WARNING: Loss will result in the end of this side story.
Description: Is it wise to feed the Serpent? Will it, once again, start devouring islands until there is nothing left of the archipelago? Of course not, protests the Serpent. Only, it has not eaten since times immemorial, and if it is to help, it will need to absorb some essence...
Victory_Text:
The Serpent eats and eats, and eventually... it stops, apparently sated. Apparently, it intends on being true to its word when it said it will not eat the entire archipelago.
Slowly awakening, the Serpent promises its help in return for the freedom spirits have just granted to it.
Unlocks: If you won (either during your first or second game), unlock Serpent Slumbering Beneath the Island.

Title: Despicable Theft
Default_Spirits: Grinning Trickster Stirs Up Trouble, Downpour Drenches the World
Restricted_Spirits: Many Minds Move as One, Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares
Game_Effects: Use Despicable theft default scenario
Description: Left to their own devices for too long, invaders appear to have found what they are looking for: already, they are hurrying back to their ship, an aura of victory emanating from them. Already present, Grinning Trickster Stirs Up Trouble is doing its best to prevent them from departing with the artifacts they seem to have stolen from the very core of the island... but it seems to be too little, too late.
Victory_Text:
In a most uncharacteristic manner, invaders depart, leaving spirits and Dahan alone on the shore. This can only mean one thing: they have found what they are looking for.
There is little to be done now but wait for the next wave of invaders, and try to thwart what new strategy they may have in store.

Title: Endless Night
Mandatory_Spirits: A Spread of Rampant Green, Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares
Game_Effects: Invader cards are turned face-down outside the Invader phase. This does not affect gameplay, it only adds the difficulty of remembering the content of those cards during spirit and power phases.
Description:
The storm brought forth by Lightning's Swift Strike fades shortly after its departure, but the darkness remains. The rain stops, and the clouds clear away, and yet, as days turn into weeks, the supernatural night persists. Dahan say: The newcomers have angered the Night, and they are not far from the mark, for the dayless curse is the doing of Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares, displeased by the destruction the invaders have already caused.
However, in the darkness, invaders are not idle, and they ceaselessly keep trying to establish roots on the island.
Victory_Text:
Dawn finally breaks as Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares takes a more compact form, better suited for events to unfold. It approaches A Spread of Rampant Green with a question. Spirits dream just like Dahan, and in the dreams of four spirits, odd objects have started to appear. Perhaps those objects have been found somewhere in the Green?
It isn't so, replies A Spread of Rampant Green, but perhaps another spirit, one whose senses are sharper, could be of help? Drawing its attention shouldn't be too difficult...

Title: AFFINITY - Spirits of Storm and Rain
Mandatory_Spirits: Lightning's Swift Strike, Downpour Drenches the World
Game_Effects: Use Rituals of the Destroying Flame default scenario
Description:
Lightning's Swift Strike and Downpour Drenches the World have always had affection for each other. Often, they would meet high up in the sky and gleefully dance for days and days.
Some would say the invaders' decision to use magic of their own is the reason they came back together again, but the truth is, they were just looking for an opportunity to start their dance anew.
Victory_Text: The invaders regroup and hide under what is left of their towns and cities, unwilling to set a foot outside in the rain, as the Lightning keeps falling around them. Near them, Dahan celebrate and dance under the rain: such is their way to partake in the dance of the spirits of the Storm.
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, reveal Artifact #3 and Artifact #57.
If you won during your second game, only reveal Artifact #57.

Title: Victory by Fear
Board_Setup:
Thematic Map North-West, West and South-West.
You may want to re-read rules regarding extra island boards (JE p. 18).
Game_Effects:
If you have not unlocked at least 2 spirits, immediately unlock Heart of the Wildfire and lower your FINAL SCORE by 1. If you have not unlocked a single spirit, also unlock Serpent Slumbering Beneath the Island, and lower your FINAL SCORE by 1 more.

You can only win by achieving Fear Level: VICTORY
Description: Some spirits believe the best way to send a message is to leverage Weaves a Web of Souls' stratagem, and instill fear on such a level that invaders will never consider coming back. They prepare to unfold their strategy.
Victory_Text: As invaders flee in disarray, spirits take a moment to celebrate: invaders are gone, and the horizon looks clear. Hopefully, this will be enough to keep the island safe until Will-Be becomes Was.
Unlocks: After completing both this scenario and Scenario #74, read Annex 5.

Title: An invader seeks
Default_Spirits: Bringer of Dreams and Nightmares, Sharp Fangs Behind the Leaves, Vital Strength of the Earth
Restricted_Spirits: A Spread of Rampant Green, Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds
Game_Effects: Use Guard the Isle's Heart default scenario
Description: Vital Strength of the Earth offers to stay and help for a moment before returning to the defense of its own island. The invaders, true to its prediction, seem to aim for something located deep within the island. All spirits agree: they must not find what they are looking for.
Victory_Text: The question remains in the air again, but this time, something akin to an answer is formulated. The sultry voice from Behind the Leaves mentions another Stalker, one who preys on Hidden Secrets. Surely this one could explain the invaders' odd behaviour.

Title: BENEATH THE ARCHIPELAGO: Origin story
Game_Effects:
Use Elemental Invocation default scenario.
Additional victory condition: a land where Volcano Looming High has at least 4 presences has an elemental marker on all corners.
WARNING: Loss will result in the end of this side story.
Description: Few spirits were there from the beginning. Ocean's Hungry Grasp itself may have existed, but it wasn't prowling around. The Pathmaker is older than most, but it only started visiting the island once beasts migrated there. The oldest among all spirits to still be active today is probably Volcano Looming High. Maybe an offering to the mountain-spirit would put it in a good mood, and it would be inclined to share a few stories on the origin of the island?
Victory_Text:
According to its account, Volcano Looming High had many younger siblings, back then. They alone were standing tall above the ocean. One day, a Serpent came by, and tired of swimming, asked to rest upon their backs. They generously offered him a place to rest, but the Serpent soon became hungry. With nothing to eat for miles around, the Serpent decided to eat the smallest among them, and after having fed, it grew larger. As it grew, so did its hunger, so the Serpent ate the second smallest island. Once again, it grew, became hungry, and started eating all the islands
one after the other, from the smallest to the largest. In order to protect itself and its remaining siblings, Volcano Looming High decided to cast a veil of smoke in the eyes of the Serpent. Blinded and furious, the Serpent decided to protect itself by wrapping the earth around itself. When it did so, Volcano Looming High quickly turned the earth into a prison of stone, forever locking the Serpent beneath the archipelago.
Unlocks: If you won (either during your first or second game), unlock Scenario #7.

Title: CHILD OF THE VOLCANO AND THE GREEN: Home of the Island's Heart
Game_Effects:
Use A Diversity of Spirits default scenario.
WARNING: Loss will result in the end of this side story.
Description: Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds had spoken of another spirit, a child of the Volcano and the Green, sleeping somewhere on the archipelago. To reach it, spirits would first have to cross the Deepest Wilderness. This is a place odd spirits call their home; a place as enticing as it is alien... and dangerous, even for spirits. Visitors would be hard pressed to say whether the spirits residing in this environment are trying to help or hamper them. Regardless, to find the one they are looking for, they will have to go in...
Victory_Text: Reaching the Deep Wilderness was the easy part; leaving it is another problem altogether. Spirits make their way, confident in the direction they chose, only to find themselves back where they started after hours, sometimes days. Mountains seem to shift place on the horizon; rivers change their course to confuse them, and jungles keep promising oh so plentiful rewards! All of a sudden, the Deep Wilderness seemed just as hostile as they seemed inviting.
Unlocks: If you won (either during your first or second game), unlock scenario #47.

Title: Hunters of beasts
Default_Spirits: Shifting Memory of Ages, Lure of the Deep Wilderness, Finder of Paths Unseen
Game_Effects: Use Guard the Isle's Heart default scenario
Description:
The very centre of the archipelago is hard to reach, both to invaders and spirits.
Invaders only interested in settling in go for easier to reach shores; those are interested in something different: it is said that the greatest among beasts dwell deep within the island, and it is the appeal that have Lured them so Deep.
Of spirits there are few: the first and most prominent being, of course, Lure of the Deep Wilderness, comfortable in this recluse kingdom. Beside it, Finder of Paths Unseen is known for passing by on its way to one destination or the next; the centre of the island is often one of its preferred routes. Finally, Shifting Memory of Ages has chosen those islands as its home, possibly because the islands, shielded from the ever-changing outside world, remind it of something it used to know, a long time ago...
Victory_Text: Invaders still seek something deep within the island. Perhaps they hope to reinstate the ritual that gave them invulnerability, thinking that the second time around, it will work permanently, instead of working on rare occasions. Perhaps they have decided on a new ritual. Perhaps they h ave something else in mind entirely. Their objective is of little consequence: the destruction they cause along the way is alarming enough to convince most spirits that they must leave as soon as possible.

Title: A Rumor Among Dahan
Game_Effects: Use the Dahan Insurrection default scenario
Description: Shadows Flicker Like Flame's curiosity got piqued by rumors circulating among the Dahan: rumors of another island, where they are invited to go help repel invaders in a much more direct manner. Certainly, something worth seeing. And what of this Thunderspeaker the Dahan are often speaking about? Perhaps it could help as well...
Victory_Text: The aftermath of the confrontation is bloody, and there is nothing but sorrow on Thunderspeaker's human-looking face. As Shadows Flicker Like Flame approaches it, it speaks, its voice roaring like Thunder. It speaks of the arrivals of invaders, here too, at the other end of the archipelago. It speaks furiously, and as it speaks, the sky darkens. Shadows Flicker Like Flame leaves with more questions than answers.

Title: The Story of the Moon that Was Angry at the Sun
Default_Spirits: Vital Strength of the Earth, Stone's Unyielding Defiance
Game_Effects: Use The Great River default scenario.
Description:
As the story goes, the Sun stayed up in the sky, unrelenting for two entire months. The Moon became offended with the Sun's presence, and in an attempt to take back its rightful place in the sky, it decided to ram itself into the Sun. The Sun is bigger and brighter than the Moon, so upon impact, the Moon shattered to pieces, while the Sun only lost a single beam of Sunshine. However, the impact was enough to push the Sun back over the horizon, and the Moon managed to get back its place in the Sky. It is said that since then, the Moon spends its time seeking pieces of itself and gathering them to become whole again, only to lose them over the course of the next few weeks and having to seek them all over again, repeating this cycle for ever and ever.
On the day of the impact, the story tells us that the entire Sky was Split, and the two celestial bodies, markers of time, Fractured the Days themselves. Pieces of Might-Have-Been flew back, in the Sky that Was, and there, caught Lightning's Swift Strike's attention, teaching it of the aspects it could take. Pieces of Will-Be flew back as well, and it is believed that it is Stalker of Hidden Secrets who managed to catch them.
On that day, invaders lost their invulnerability, though it is believed that they remembered a way to bring it back, only during daytime, and only for smaller groups.
As for Stone's Unyielding Defiance and Vital Strength of the Earth, they were trying to push back increasingly large groups of invaders when the Sky Fractured, and unexpected help came to their support.
Victory_Text:
The Sky kept on shaking from the impact for numerous weeks. It is said that a piece of Starlight, unable to hold on to the heavens, fell all the way down to the archipelago, in farmland almost entirely abandoned to the invaders. Were it not from Stone's Unyielding Defiance, it certainly would have dissolved.
New to the archipelago and the world as a whole, the newly formed spirit had little time to find its bearing before a new wave of invaders emerged on the horizon.

Title: ASPECT of Foreboding
Mandatory_Spirits: Lure of the Deep Wilderness, Shadows Flicker Like Flame
Game_Effects:
Use Powers Long Forgotten default scenario.
Additional loss condition: invaders discover all sources of power.
Spirits do not benefit from the first source of power they find.
Description:
Lure of the Deep Wilderness' help is like none other: it is a bizarre spirit, with whom it is hardly possible to communicate. For this reason, perhaps, it was perfectly suited to help Shadows Flicker Like Flame: in an alien way, they understood each other.
As invaders abandoned their post to travel ever-inland, those who stayed behind started feeling distraught. As their Shadows started Flickering, this feeling evolved to become Foreboding.
Victory_Text: It is not always easy to measure a spirit's influence. In their battle against invaders, some spirits smash houses and ships; other spirits let vines and beasts go wild. How would one measure the importance of the day when invaders decided to step away from the island without any bloodshed, solely because they were confident something terrible would happen if they were to step foot on the island?
Unlocks:
If you won during your first game, unlock Shadows Flicker Like Flame's Foreboding aspect.
If you won during your second game, instead reveal Artifact #14.
Regardless of the outcome, unlock Scenario #16.

Title: Cleaning Up is a Drag
Restricted_Spirits: Keeper of the Forbidden Wilds, Grinning Trickster Stirs Up Trouble
Game_Effects:
During game setup:
-Add 1 blight to land #1, 1 blight to land #3, and 1 blight to land #8 on each board. The blight comes from the box, not the blight card.
-Add 1 beast token to land #8 on one board only.
-Look through the minor power deck and take Renewing Boon, Absorb Corruption and Call to tend, and add them to the hand of either player.

Additional victory condition: there are at most 2 blights on each board.
Description:
Spirits arrive to the South-Eastern island to find it in a severe state of disarray, blight already covering a large part of the island. There, they are greeted by an oddly large Dahan wearing a disproportionately large hat.
Help?, it says. Oh, help can be provided. However, the Dahan - no, the invaders - oh, honestly, pretty much all other local spirits - have left this place quite a mess, and help cannot be provided until the island is back to a more orderly state. Would the spirits be so kind as to help clean up the island?
As soon as the spirits agree, the oddly large Dahan disappears, leaving them alone with the task of cleaning up the island.
They observe the land before them, still fresh from a recent arson...

Are those... tigers?
Victory_Text:
